content.content:
---
title: Latest Bluesky User Count & Growth Stats (2025)
author: Zeid Abughazaleh
url: https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/
hostname: proxidize.com
description: The Bluesky user count has soared to over 25 million users as of December 2024, reflecting a remarkable surge from 13 million just two months earlier. The
sitename: Proxidize
date: 2025-01-30
---
The Bluesky user count has soared to over 25 million users as of December 2024, reflecting a remarkable surge from 13 million just two months earlier. The platform is currently growing at a rate of 5.4 users per second and is attracting approximately 466,500 new users daily.

This influx underscores Bluesky‚Äôs rapid expansion, especially among younger audiences where 42% of the user base is between 18-24. Brazil alone accounts for 37.7% of traffic, with the United States following at 25.6%.

In this article, we‚Äôll examine Bluesky‚Äôs explosive growth, explore its user demographics, and discuss the key statistics that illustrate its emergence as a formidable social media platform.

**What Is Bluesky?**

Bluesky takes a novel approach to social networking by functioning as a decentralized platform built on the AT Protocol. The project is open-source, giving anyone transparent insight into its design. Users can share 300-character text messages, images, and videos, all while controlling the nature of their feeds.

But how exactly does Bluesky differentiate itself? One answer is its ‚Äúmarketplace of algorithms‚Äù that lets users choose or create custom feeds based on preferences. With over 50k custom feeds available, Bluesky offers a unique degree of flexibility in shaping one‚Äôs experience. The platform also includes user-managed moderation and labeling services, plus user-made ‚Äústarter packs‚Äù that help newcomers jump in with relevant communities.

In terms of corporate identity, Bluesky operates as a Public Benefit Corporation, with ownership primarily held by CEO Jay Graber and the Bluesky team. They are supported by a board that features notable innovators like Jeremie Miller (inventor of Jabber/XMPP), Mike Masnick, and Kinjal Shah. This structure preserves the platform‚Äôs focus on growing and promoting open-source technology for decentralized public conversation.

Bluesky‚Äôs handle system is another hallmark. Instead of relying on standard ‚Äúcheckmarks,‚Äù the platform uses domain name-based handles that require users to prove domain ownership. This approach aims to preserve authenticity and give creators independence in self-identification.

**Who Owns Bluesky?**

Originally a Twitter-side project in 2019, Bluesky spun off in 2021 as an independent company and Public Benefit Corporation. Today, CEO Jay Graber ‚Äî previously behind the event-coordination platform ‚ÄúHappening‚Äù ‚Äî owns much of Bluesky, while the rest is distributed among the internal team.

The board includes:

**Jeremie Miller**: Renowned for inventing Jabber/XMPP.**Mike Masnick**: Founder of TechDirt and the Copia Institute think tank.**Kinjal Shah**: General partner at Blockchain Capital.

Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, who started the Bluesky initiative, left the board in May 2024. Post-departure, Dorsey directed a significant $5 million investment to Nostr, another decentralized platform. Meanwhile, Bluesky secured $5 million in funding ‚Äî led by Blockchain Capital ‚Äî in October 2024. So far, the company has raised $36 million in total, opting against traditional advertising and exploring subscription models instead.

**Explosive User Growth in 2024-2025**

September 2024 was pivotal for Bluesky: the platform went from 9 million users to 20 million by November, marking a jaw-dropping 189% growth rate that month ‚Äî plus a 284% spike in daily active users.

Although growth slowed a bit in December, there was still a solid 9.6% increase in US website visits, easily outpacing competitor Threads, which slipped by 1.6%. Globally, Bluesky‚Äôs momentum in December 2024 looked like this:

**Monthly Growth**

Platform | Oct 2024 | Nov 2024 | Dec 2024 |
| Bluesky | 11.23% | 75.15% | 9.5% |
| Threads | 9.05% | 8.13% | 5.7% |
| X | 6.93% | -2.27% | 2.4% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Notably, the presidential election news in November 2024 acted as a huge catalyst, leading Bluesky to dominate the US App Store rankings for more than a week. High-profile users ‚Äî including celebrities, journalists, and creators ‚Äî flocked to the platform, driving up engagement by as much as tenfold for some organizations.

By the end of 2024, Bluesky‚Äôs worldwide growth had shot up by 930% year-over-year, while its two-year growth topped 30,564%. That performance solidified Bluesky‚Äôs status as a serious contender in the [social media](https://proxidize.com/blog/social-media-management/) network space.

**Key Growth Catalysts and Milestones**

**US Presidential Election Impact**

The US presidential election in November 2024 set off a surge of 13 million new users in just six weeks. During the window of November 6-15, daily website visits in the US ballooned by 519%, compared to average traffic for the first ten months of 2024.

Interactions also skyrocketed, with some organizations reporting a 2x to 10x jump in engagement. Unsurprisingly, the platform processed a record-breaking 6.5 million content violation reports ‚Äî a 17-fold leap from the previous year.

**Brazil Market Expansion**

A temporary ban of X in Brazil led to Bluesky registering 2.6 million new users in a single week. Of those, a staggering 85% were from Brazil, fundamentally [reshaping the platform‚Äôs user demographics](https://proxidize.com/blog/geolocation-testing/):

Region | Traffic Share |
| Brazil | 37.7% |
| United States | 25.6% |
| Other Markets | 36.7% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

This sudden growth led to a backlog in user-managed moderation and labelling services, prompting Bluesky to scale its Portuguese-language moderation team and automate riskier areas. Simultaneously, an engineering team of 20 full-time employees (sometimes noted as 20 full-time employees) introduced new tools such as video sharing and trending topics to accommodate the larger audience.

**Bluesky Statistics**

Recent [demographic data](https://proxidize.com/use-cases/market-research/) offers a deep dive into Bluesky‚Äôs usage statistics. Notably, male users make up about 69.63% of the audience, while female users account for roughly 30.37%.

**Age and Gender Distribution**

The average user on Bluesky skews young, with 42% in the 18-24 bracket:

Age Group | Percentage |
| 18-24 | 42.0% |
| 25-34 | 27.5% |
| 35-44 | 13.3% |
| 45-54 | 7.7% |
| 55-64 | 5.6% |
| 65+ | 3.8% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Altogether, 70% of active users are under 34, reflecting a strong foothold among younger demographics. Engagement metrics are equally robust: the average visit durations are 9 minutes 46 seconds, with 1.51 pages viewed per session.

In terms of traffic sources, direct access accounts for 44.1% of visits, referrals generate 29.06%, organic search pulls 21.26%, and social media funnels 4.79%.

Meanwhile, the platform‚Äôs lean workforce ‚Äî about 20 full-time employees and 100 contractors ‚Äî has managed to support the rising exodus of users from rival platforms while keeping moderation operations stable.

**Website Traffic Analysis**

In December 2024, Bluesky recorded 154.68 million monthly website visits ‚Äî up 93% from October. The table below illustrates the platform‚Äôs top traffic sources:

**Direct**: 44.1%**Referral**: 29.06%**Organic Search**: 21.26%**Social Media**: 4.79%

**App Download Statistics**

Monthly app downloads remained consistently high in 2024:

Month (2024) | Downloads |
| September | 2.85M |
| October | 2.76M |
| November | 7.85M |
| December | 1.76M |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Clearly, November was a surge in usage, coinciding with a broader exodus of users from competing services.

**User Engagement Rates**

Usage statistics also underscore Bluesky‚Äôs impressive engagement. On average, visitors spend around 9 minutes and 46 seconds per session. Overall figures include:

**Total posts**: 973.80 million**Total follows**: 1.982 billion**Total likes**: 4.698 billion

Publishers see some of the biggest gains, often experiencing 3-4x more clicks and conversions than on rival platforms. For instance, The Boston Globe logged a 4.5x increase in conversions to paid subscriptions via Bluesky compared to other social media service sites.

**Conclusion**

From 9 million to 25 million users in just a few months, Bluesky‚Äôs meteoric rise speaks for itself. The platform‚Äôs decentralization, block feature, and algorithmic choice have proven especially appealing to users looking for a social platform that puts them in control.

**Key Takeaways:**

**Young, Global Demographic**: 42% of users are 18-24, with Brazil at 37.7% of traffic and the US at 25.6%.**Decentralized Platform**: Built on the AT Protocol, offering over 50k custom feeds and user-managed moderation.**Explosive Growth**: Jumped from 9M to 20M users in two months, peaking with a 189% monthly growth rate and 930% year-over-year increase.**Election & Brazil Ban Boost**: US presidential election added 13M users in six weeks; X‚Äôs ban in Brazil brought 2.6M users in one week.**High Engagement**: Average session lasts 9 minutes 46 seconds; total posts at 973.80M, total follows at 1.982B, total likes at 4.698B.**Bright Outlook**: Annual growth of 930% and two-year growth of 30,564% underscore Bluesky‚Äôs appeal as a fast-scaling social media platform.

The cross-border appeal ‚Äî spanning from the US to Brazil ‚Äî backs up its ambition to become more than just another social network. Average session lengths nearing 10 minutes and triple-digit traffic growth show that this social media app is managing to sustain engagement, even with a relatively small employee base.

Perhaps most notably, Bluesky‚Äôs annual growth of 930% and two-year growth hitting 30,564% confirm its ability to scale and keep pace with user demand. {"url": "https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/", "content": "---
title: Latest Bluesky User Count & Growth Stats (2025)
author: Zeid Abughazaleh
url: https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/
hostname: proxidize.com
description: The Bluesky user count has soared to over 25 million users as of December 2024, reflecting a remarkable surge from 13 million just two months earlier. The
sitename: Proxidize
date: 2025-01-30
---
The Bluesky user count has soared to over 25 million users as of December 2024, reflecting a remarkable surge from 13 million just two months earlier. The platform is currently growing at a rate of 5.4 users per second and is attracting approximately 466,500 new users daily.

This influx underscores Bluesky’s rapid expansion, especially among younger audiences where 42% of the user base is between 18-24. Brazil alone accounts for 37.7% of traffic, with the United States following at 25.6%.

In this article, we’ll examine Bluesky’s explosive growth, explore its user demographics, and discuss the key statistics that illustrate its emergence as a formidable social media platform.

**What Is Bluesky?**

Bluesky takes a novel approach to social networking by functioning as a decentralized platform built on the AT Protocol. The project is open-source, giving anyone transparent insight into its design. Users can share 300-character text messages, images, and videos, all while controlling the nature of their feeds.

But how exactly does Bluesky differentiate itself? One answer is its “marketplace of algorithms” that lets users choose or create custom feeds based on preferences. With over 50k custom feeds available, Bluesky offers a unique degree of flexibility in shaping one’s experience. The platform also includes user-managed moderation and labeling services, plus user-made “starter packs” that help newcomers jump in with relevant communities.

In terms of corporate identity, Bluesky operates as a Public Benefit Corporation, with ownership primarily held by CEO Jay Graber and the Bluesky team. They are supported by a board that features notable innovators like Jeremie Miller (inventor of Jabber/XMPP), Mike Masnick, and Kinjal Shah. This structure preserves the platform’s focus on growing and promoting open-source technology for decentralized public conversation.

Bluesky’s handle system is another hallmark. Instead of relying on standard “checkmarks,” the platform uses domain name-based handles that require users to prove domain ownership. This approach aims to preserve authenticity and give creators independence in self-identification.

**Who Owns Bluesky?**

Originally a Twitter-side project in 2019, Bluesky spun off in 2021 as an independent company and Public Benefit Corporation. Today, CEO Jay Graber — previously behind the event-coordination platform “Happening” — owns much of Bluesky, while the rest is distributed among the internal team.

The board includes:

**Jeremie Miller**: Renowned for inventing Jabber/XMPP.**Mike Masnick**: Founder of TechDirt and the Copia Institute think tank.**Kinjal Shah**: General partner at Blockchain Capital.

Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, who started the Bluesky initiative, left the board in May 2024. Post-departure, Dorsey directed a significant $5 million investment to Nostr, another decentralized platform. Meanwhile, Bluesky secured $5 million in funding — led by Blockchain Capital — in October 2024. So far, the company has raised $36 million in total, opting against traditional advertising and exploring subscription models instead.

**Explosive User Growth in 2024-2025**

September 2024 was pivotal for Bluesky: the platform went from 9 million users to 20 million by November, marking a jaw-dropping 189% growth rate that month — plus a 284% spike in daily active users.

Although growth slowed a bit in December, there was still a solid 9.6% increase in US website visits, easily outpacing competitor Threads, which slipped by 1.6%. Globally, Bluesky’s momentum in December 2024 looked like this:

**Monthly Growth**

Platform | Oct 2024 | Nov 2024 | Dec 2024 |
| Bluesky | 11.23% | 75.15% | 9.5% |
| Threads | 9.05% | 8.13% | 5.7% |
| X | 6.93% | -2.27% | 2.4% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Notably, the presidential election news in November 2024 acted as a huge catalyst, leading Bluesky to dominate the US App Store rankings for more than a week. High-profile users — including celebrities, journalists, and creators — flocked to the platform, driving up engagement by as much as tenfold for some organizations.

By the end of 2024, Bluesky’s worldwide growth had shot up by 930% year-over-year, while its two-year growth topped 30,564%. That performance solidified Bluesky’s status as a serious contender in the [social media](https://proxidize.com/blog/social-media-management/) network space.

**Key Growth Catalysts and Milestones**

**US Presidential Election Impact**

The US presidential election in November 2024 set off a surge of 13 million new users in just six weeks. During the window of November 6-15, daily website visits in the US ballooned by 519%, compared to average traffic for the first ten months of 2024.

Interactions also skyrocketed, with some organizations reporting a 2x to 10x jump in engagement. Unsurprisingly, the platform processed a record-breaking 6.5 million content violation reports — a 17-fold leap from the previous year.

**Brazil Market Expansion**

A temporary ban of X in Brazil led to Bluesky registering 2.6 million new users in a single week. Of those, a staggering 85% were from Brazil, fundamentally [reshaping the platform’s user demographics](https://proxidize.com/blog/geolocation-testing/):

Region | Traffic Share |
| Brazil | 37.7% |
| United States | 25.6% |
| Other Markets | 36.7% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

This sudden growth led to a backlog in user-managed moderation and labelling services, prompting Bluesky to scale its Portuguese-language moderation team and automate riskier areas. Simultaneously, an engineering team of 20 full-time employees (sometimes noted as 20 full-time employees) introduced new tools such as video sharing and trending topics to accommodate the larger audience.

**Bluesky Statistics**

Recent [demographic data](https://proxidize.com/use-cases/market-research/) offers a deep dive into Bluesky’s usage statistics. Notably, male users make up about 69.63% of the audience, while female users account for roughly 30.37%.

**Age and Gender Distribution**

The average user on Bluesky skews young, with 42% in the 18-24 bracket:

Age Group | Percentage |
| 18-24 | 42.0% |
| 25-34 | 27.5% |
| 35-44 | 13.3% |
| 45-54 | 7.7% |
| 55-64 | 5.6% |
| 65+ | 3.8% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Altogether, 70% of active users are under 34, reflecting a strong foothold among younger demographics. Engagement metrics are equally robust: the average visit durations are 9 minutes 46 seconds, with 1.51 pages viewed per session.

In terms of traffic sources, direct access accounts for 44.1% of visits, referrals generate 29.06%, organic search pulls 21.26%, and social media funnels 4.79%.

Meanwhile, the platform’s lean workforce — about 20 full-time employees and 100 contractors — has managed to support the rising exodus of users from rival platforms while keeping moderation operations stable.

**Website Traffic Analysis**

In December 2024, Bluesky recorded 154.68 million monthly website visits — up 93% from October. The table below illustrates the platform’s top traffic sources:

**Direct**: 44.1%**Referral**: 29.06%**Organic Search**: 21.26%**Social Media**: 4.79%

**App Download Statistics**

Monthly app downloads remained consistently high in 2024:

Month (2024) | Downloads |
| September | 2.85M |
| October | 2.76M |
| November | 7.85M |
| December | 1.76M |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Clearly, November was a surge in usage, coinciding with a broader exodus of users from competing services.

**User Engagement Rates**

Usage statistics also underscore Bluesky’s impressive engagement. On average, visitors spend around 9 minutes and 46 seconds per session. Overall figures include:

**Total posts**: 973.80 million**Total follows**: 1.982 billion**Total likes**: 4.698 billion

Publishers see some of the biggest gains, often experiencing 3-4x more clicks and conversions than on rival platforms. For instance, The Boston Globe logged a 4.5x increase in conversions to paid subscriptions via Bluesky compared to other social media service sites.

**Conclusion**

From 9 million to 25 million users in just a few months, Bluesky’s meteoric rise speaks for itself. The platform’s decentralization, block feature, and algorithmic choice have proven especially appealing to users looking for a social platform that puts them in control.

**Key Takeaways:**

**Young, Global Demographic**: 42% of users are 18-24, with Brazil at 37.7% of traffic and the US at 25.6%.**Decentralized Platform**: Built on the AT Protocol, offering over 50k custom feeds and user-managed moderation.**Explosive Growth**: Jumped from 9M to 20M users in two months, peaking with a 189% monthly growth rate and 930% year-over-year increase.**Election & Brazil Ban Boost**: US presidential election added 13M users in six weeks; X’s ban in Brazil brought 2.6M users in one week.**High Engagement**: Average session lasts 9 minutes 46 seconds; total posts at 973.80M, total follows at 1.982B, total likes at 4.698B.**Bright Outlook**: Annual growth of 930% and two-year growth of 30,564% underscore Bluesky’s appeal as a fast-scaling social media platform.

The cross-border appeal — spanning from the US to Brazil — backs up its ambition to become more than just another social network. Average session lengths nearing 10 minutes and triple-digit traffic growth show that this social media app is managing to sustain engagement, even with a relatively small employee base.

Perhaps most notably, Bluesky’s annual growth of 930% and two-year growth hitting 30,564% confirm its ability to scale and keep pace with user demand. As daily users continue to climb, the platform’s future looks bright, thanks to its decentralized platform model, user-focused features, and an ever-expanding user base that craves genuine engagement.

{"url": "https://adamconnell.me/bluesky-statistics/", "content": "---
title: Bluesky Statistics For 2025 (Users, Demographics, Growth)
author: Adam Connell
url: https://adamconnell.me/bluesky-statistics/
hostname: adamconnell.me
description: Bluesky is one of the fastest-growing social apps. In this post, I’ll share 27 Bluesky statistics you need to know, covering users, demographics, and more….
sitename: Adam Connell
date: 2025-01-16
---
# Bluesky Statistics For 2025 (Users, Demographics, Growth)

Looking for the latest Bluesky statistics? You’re in the right place.

Bluesky is the app everyone’s talking about right now.

Following a recent surge in user numbers, it’s become one of the fastest-growing social media platforms. This has led many to wonder if Bluesky will finally emerge as a serious competitor to rival platform X (formerly Twitter).

In this post, I’ll be sharing 27 stats that reveal more about Bluesky’s meteoric growth, its user demographics, and other interesting insights.

## Top picks

- Bluesky has 23.2 million total users and 3.2 million daily active users (Theo.io, Similarweb3)
- Users visit the Bluesky website 75.8 million times monthly… (Similarweb)
- …and download the Bluesky app 400k times daily (Appfigures)
- Bluesky users have shared over 658 million posts in total (bsky.jazco.dev)
- Bluesky users have followed accounts 1.1 billion times and liked posts 1.1 billion times (bsky.jazco.dev)
- Bluesky (@bsky.app) is the most-followed account on the platform (VQV.APP)
- Most Bluesky users are from Brazil (37.7%), the US (25.6%), and Japan (8.7%) (Similarweb, Bluesky1)

## Bluesky user statistics

First, let’s look at statistics that highlight how many people currently use Bluesky, how those numbers have changed over time, and the factors that are driving its growth.

### 1. Bluesky has over 23.2 million total registered users…

At the time of writing, around 23.2 million people have signed up for Bluesky—and that figure is changing rapidly. By the time you read this post, it may be significantly higher.

Bluesky still has a long way to go to catch up to rival platform X, which is the 11th [most-used social media platform](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/) with 619 million users. However, if Bluesky maintains its current momentum, it may begin to close that gap over the next few years.

Source: Theo.io

### 2. …that’s up from just 1 million users last year…

Since raising their seed round in 2023, Bluesky has gone from an invite-only app with a modest 1 million users to an open app with more than 23.2 million users from all over the world…and counting!

What’s more, most of those new users signed up in just the last few months alone. Bluesky had just 5 million users as of March 2024. And an incredible 2.6 million new users registered within just a few days at the start of September 2024.

Source: Bluesky6

### 3. …and is increasing by 5.4 users per second

According to theo.io’s user counter, 5.4 users are registering for Bluesky every second (at the time of writing). That works out to 324 new users a minute, 19,440 new users an hour, and roughly 466.5k new users a day.

The rate at which new users sign up for the platform is constantly changing—and it’s been even faster in the past. At one point in November this year, Bluesky was adding roughly a million new users a day.

Source: Theo.io, Bluesky5

### 4. Bluesky has around 3.2 million daily active users (DAUs) in the US

As of mid-November 2024, around 3.2 million people in the US use Bluesky daily. That number has ticked up dramatically over the last month.

Site: Similarweb3

### 5. Bluesky usage in the US is up 500% since election day

The US election served as a catalyst for the ongoing exodus of users from Bluesky’s rival social media app, X.

Many liberal users expressed concerns about misinformation on the platform, as well as concerns that X was used as a vehicle to help with the Republican’s election campaign due to owner Elon Musk’s political leanings and close ties to the Trump administration.

As a result, liberal users have been leaving X in droves—and many of them have found their way to Bluesky, which has caused this recent surge in usage. Aside from the US, Bluesky usage is also up 350% in the UK since the US election.

Site: Similarweb3

### 6. Bluesky gained 3 million new users the week after X was suspended in Brazil…

Earlier this year, Brazil’s Supreme Court suspended X. As a result, Brazilians who could no longer access X signed up for Bluesky instead, which led to one of the biggest leaps in user numbers Bluesky has seen to date.

Source: Bluesky7

### 7. …and 1.2 million new users in the days following the announcement that X would change the ‘block’ feature

Earlier this year, X made the controversial decision to change its block feature so that users could still see content from accounts they’d blocked—a change that was widely criticized.

Again, Bluesky was well-positioned to capitalize on this as 1.2 million disgruntled users who left X as a result of the change signed up for Bluesky instead.

Source: Bluesky8

### 8. There are over 671 million posts on Bluesky

…and counting! Users create tens of thousands of posts every day, so by the time you’re reading this, there are probably already millions more.

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 9. There are around 1.3 million daily unique posters on Bluesky

This varies every day, but it’s somewhere around that ballpark at the time of writing (November 2024).

Notably, that’s significantly higher than last month, when there were just 293k unique daily posters.

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

## Bluesky engagement statistics

Next, let’s look at some more Bluesky statistics about how users engage with content and accounts on the platform.

### 10. There are over 1.1 billion total followers across all Bluesky accounts…

That’s the number you get if you add up the followers of every user on Bluesky.

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 11. …and over 2.9 billion total likes

Users on Bluesky have liked a combined total of 2.9 billion posts so far… and counting!

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 12. 50% of Bluesky users only have 1 follower

As Bluesky is still in its infancy, few users on the platform have managed to gain a significant number of followers (yet). Around half of all Bluesky users only have a single follower, and only the top 0.01% have accrued over 10k followers.

Percentage of accounts | Number of followers |
| 50% | 1+ |
| 25% | 6+ |
| 10% | 34+ |
| 5% | 85+ |
| 1% | 400+ |
| 0.1% | 2,238+ |
| 0.01% | 11,241+ |

*Related: **How To Grow Your Social Media Following The Right Way*

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 13. The most followed account on Bluesky is… Bluesky!

When you sign up for Bluesky, you automatically follow Bluesky (@bsky.app) by default. So unsurprisingly, Bluesky is the most-followed account on the platform with 15.9 million followers.

The table below shows the rest of the top-5 most-followed accounts on the platform at the time of writing.

Top 5 most-followed Bluesky accounts | Number of followers |
| Bluesky (@bsky.app) | 15.9 million |
| Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (@aoc.bsky.social) | 914,000 |
| George Takei (@georgetakei.bsky.social) | 797,000 |
| The New York Times (@nytimes.com) | 725,000 |
| The Onion (@theonion.com) | 704,000 |

Source: VQV.APP

### 14. The most-liked post on Bluesky has 242.3k likes

According to Bluesky’s feed of most popular posts on platforms by likes, the most-liked post is from Bluesky themselves (@bsky.app), in which they celebrate reaching a million new users.

The second most-liked post is another celebratory post from Bluesky (222.3k likes), and the third is from Mark Hamill (@markhamillofficial.bsky.social) with a joke about quitting Twitter (170.1k likes).

Source: Bluesky2

### 15. There are over 50,000 custom feeds on Bluesky

One of the things that differentiates Bluesky from competitors like X is that it offers ‘algorithmic choice’ by letting users create their own custom feeds to determine what content they see.

Alternatively, they can deploy custom feeds that other users have created from the open marketplace. Over 50k custom feeds have been built so far.

## Bluesky traffic & app downloads

Below you’ll find traffic statistics from Similarweb that reveal insights about Bluesky’s website visitors.

### 16. People visited the Bluesky website over 75.8 million times last month

According to Similarweb’s traffic data, the Bluesky website (bsky.app) had around 75.8 million total website visits. Note that this doesn’t mean Bluesky had over 75.8 million *unique *visitors—many of those visits will be repeat visits from the same users.

Source: Similarweb

### 17. The average visit duration for Bluesky is 9 minutes, 46 seconds

This should be a fairly good indication of the typical Bluesky session duration, i.e. how long the average user stays on Bluesky when they open the app/website.

Source: Similarweb

### 18. Bluesky is downloaded around 400k times a day

At the time of writing, Bluesky is downloaded around 400k times per day, on average. It overtook X (which has 250k daily downloads, on average) for the first time this month (November 2024).

Source: Appfigures

### 19. Bluesky was downloaded 3.2 million times last month

Users downloaded Bluesky around 3.2 million times in October 2024. That figure was even higher in September at 5.1 million.

Source: Similarweb2

### 20. Bluesky was downloaded over 9 million times in the second half of 2024

And we’re not even at the end of the year yet, so expect that figure to increase. In comparison, Bluesky was downloaded only 1.4 million times in the first half of 2024.

Source: Business of Apps

### 21. Bluesky recently became the #1 top-performing app in the App Store

In November 2024, Bluesky became the #1 app in Apple’s App Store charts, with rival Threads in the #2 spot. The App Store charts rank apps based on download and revenue velocity, which suggests Bluesky is one of the fastest-growing apps this month.

Source: Forbes, Apple

## Bluesky demographics

What demographics make up Bluesky’s user base? Let’s look at some more Bluesky statistics to find out.

### 22. 64% of Bluesky users are male

Almost two-thirds of those who visit Bluesky are male (64%), while only a little over one-third are female (36%). This is based on traffic data from Similarweb as Bluesky hasn’t publicly shared its own internal data about user demographics.

Source: Similarweb

### 23. 42% of Bluesky users are 18 to 24 years old

It seems that Bluesky primarily appeals to younger users. According to Similarweb’s traffic data, around 42% of visitors to the site are between the ages of 18 to 24.

Age | % of Bluesky website traffic |
| 18-24 | 42% |
| 25-34 | 27.5% |
| 35-44 | 13.3% |
| 45-54 | 7.7% |
| 55-64 | 5.6% |
| 65+ | 3.8% |

Source: Similarweb

### 24. 37.7% of Bluesky’s traffic comes from Brazil

According to Similarweb, Brazil accounts for a greater portion of Bluesky’s website traffic than any other country. It’s followed by the US (25.6%), Japan (8.7%), and the UK (3.8%).

Bluesky’s Jay (@jay.bsky.team) also confirmed in a recent post that the US, Japan, and Brazil are the three biggest countries using the app.

Source: Similarweb, Bluesky1

## Misc. Bluesky statistics

Before we wrap up, here are a few more stats about Bluesky that you might find interesting.

### 25. Bluesky currently only has around 20 full-time employees

That works out at around a million users per employee, but Bluesky has said that they’re hiring, so expect this number to shoot up soon.

Source: Bluesky3

### 26. Bluesky has raised $23 million in funding

That includes a more recent $15 million series A funding round and an $8 million seed round in 2023.

Source: TechCrunch

### 27. The first ever post on Bluesky was from Paul Frazee (@pfrazee.com)

The inaugural post on Bluesky was made by developer Paul Frazee on November 16, 2022. Staying true to internet tradition, it was a simple yet iconic declaration: ‘First!’

Source: Bluesky4

## Final thoughts

As these stats show, Bluesky is currently one of the fastest-growing social media apps.

It’s successfully capitalized on the controversy surrounding X and is siphoning its users at an alarming rate.

Whether or not it will maintain its current growth rate remains to be seen. But if it does, it could spell disaster for competitors X and Threads.

Very few [social media schedulers](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-scheduler-tools/) support the platform which is likely an issue for some. That said, you can schedule to Bluesky with [SocialBee](https://adamconnell.me/go/socialbee/) (aff).

Hungry for more stats? Check out these interesting [social media statistics](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-statistics/) and [influencer marketing statistics](https://adamconnell.me/influencer-marketing-statistics/). You might also be interested in our comprehensive ranking of [the leading social media platforms by monthly active users](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/).

**Related reading:**"}

---
# Bluesky User Age, Gender, & Demographics (2025)

First launched as an independent company in 2021, Bluesky has gained plenty of recent adopters, [seeing rapid growth](https://www.similarweb.com/blog/insights/social-media-news/bluesky-sustained-growth/) in late 2024.

Many former [X users](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/x-user-stats) are [making the switch](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c8dm0ljg4y6o) from Elon Musk’s platform following increased politicization during the US elections.

Below, we’ll dive into key data related to Bluesky’s user base:

**Contents**

[Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-top-stats)[Bluesky User Statistics](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-stats)[Bluesky Users By Age](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-age)[Bluesky Users By Gender](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-gender)[Bluesky Users By Region](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-region)[Bluesky Users By Platform](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-platform)[Bluesky User Habits](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-habits)[Most Popular Accounts On Bluesky](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-popular-accounts)

### Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)

- There are
**over 33 million**Bluesky users **Approximately 1**user joins Bluesky every second- The Bluesky website gets
[196 million](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain)[visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain) **Around one-third**of Bluesky users are 18 to 24 years old**Over 60%**of Bluesky users are male**Around 2 in 5**Bluesky users are American**Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez**is the most-followed person on Bluesky

### Bluesky User Statistics

In March 2025, the total user count crossed the 33 million mark.

*Pale blue bars are estimated.*

This figure has **almost doubled** in a matter of weeks, growing from **13 million** in late October 2024, and **25 million **in December 2024.

Here’s how the number of Bluesky users has increased in Q4 2024:

| Date | Number of Bluesky Users |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 13, 2024 | 25 million |
| December 18, 2024 | 25.4 million |
| March 11, 2025 | 33 million |

At the current adoption rate, Bluesky’s user base is growing by **approximately 1** user per second.

If that rate were to hold firm, Bluesky would hit** 53 million** users by December 2025. And by December 2026, Bluesky will have surpassed **84 million** users.

The Bluesky website gets [ 196 million visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain), of which

**41.3 million**are unique visitors.

Much of Bluesky’s increased popularity has coincided with a downturn in competitor X's daily active users.


X has largely seen daily user numbers decrease as many flock to alternative Bluesky.

That's part of a wider trend of users seeking out "alternative" social platforms. Pixelfed is gaining in popularity as a decentralized Instagram equivalent, while [RedNote](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/rednote-surge) has seen a surge in US users amid the threat of a TikTok ban.

### Bluesky Users by Region

According to [Semrush traffic data for Bluesky.com](https://www.semrush.com/website/bluesky.com/overview/), the site had 362,000 visitors in November 2024.

### Bluesky Users by Platform

February 2024 saw by far the most Bluesky downloads for both iOS **(670,722)** and Android **(567,267) **operating systems.

Between February 2023 and March 2024, iOS monthly downloads have outnumbered Android on **12 of 14 **occasions.

However, each of the four most recent recorded months (May to July 2024) saw Android downloads surpass iOS. In fact, during this period, Android amassed almost twice as many downloads as iOS **(473,703 vs 240,132)**.

### Bluesky User Habits

### Most Popular Accounts on Bluesky

### Key Takeaways

# Bluesky Statistics: How Many People Use Bluesky?

Written by [Backlinko Team](https://backlinko.com/blog/authors/backlinko-team)

Publicly launched in February 2024, Bluesky is a microblogging social network, widely considered an alternative to X/Twitter.

During the invite-only stage, Bluesky attracted an audience of 3 million registered users and has since grown to become a popular social media platform with over 27 million users and counting.

Read on to find all the latest Bluesky usage statistics for 2025.

## Key Bluesky Stats

- Bluesky has
**27.44 million**users. - In November 2024, monthly installs of Bluesky app reached
**7.85 million**. - In the US and UK, Bluesky app has around
**3.5 million**daily active users. **20**full-time employees work at Bluesky

## Bluesky Registered Users

According to the latest update, Bluesky currently has **27.44 million** registered users.

Bluesky crossed the milestone of 20 million users in November 2024.

Here’s a table with number of Bluesky users over time:

| Date | Bluesky Registered Users |
|---|---|
| September 15, 204 | 10 million |
| October 19, 2024 | 12.11 million |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 19, 2024 | 25.9 million |
| January 4, 2025 | 26.31 million |
| January 14, 2025 | 27.44 million |

**Sources:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eaura22r), [Jaz’s Bsky Stats](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1536616/global-bluesky-users/), [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/16/bluesky-now-has-10-million-users/)

## Bluesky Downloads

Monthly downloads of Bluesky on Google Play and App Store combined were **1.76 million** in December 2024.

As of November, annual downloads worldwide of Bluesky in 2024 amounted to 16.52 million.

Here’s a table with monthly downloads of Bluesky app worldwide across Google Play and App Store combined:

| Date | Bluesky Downloads |
|---|---|
| February 2023 | 0.02 million |
| March 2023 | 0.09 million |
| April 2023 | 0.58 million |
| May 2023 | 0.25 million |
| June 2023 | 0.09 million |
| July 2023 | 0.62 million |
| August 2023 | 0.32 million |
| September 2023 | 0.47 million |
| October 2023 | 0.63 million |
| November 2023 | 0.41 million |
| December 2023 | 0.51 million |
| January 2024 | 0.18 million |
| February 2024 | 1.25 million |
| March 2024 | 0.16 million |
| April 2024 | 0.26 million |
| May 2024 | 0.08 million |
| June 2024 | 0.3 million |
| July 2024 | 0.07 million |
| August 2024 | 0.76 million |
| September 2024 | 2.85 million |
| October 2024 | 2.76 million |

| December 2024 | 1.76 million |

**Source:** [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1399030/global-bluesky-installs/), [Appfigures](https://appfigures.com/)

## Bluesky App Daily Active Users

According to recent data, Bluesky app has **3.5 million** daily active users in the US and UK.

**Source:** [Financial Times](https://www.ft.com/content/e1b52147-c171-4902-8bce-204ba0905912)

## Bluesky Website Monthly Visits

According to latest data, visits to Bluesky website reached **154.68 million** in December 2024, showing a 93% increase since October 2024.

Here’s a detailed breakdown of Bluesky website visits:

| Date | Bluesky Website Visits |
|---|---|
| June 2024 | 17.41 million |
| July 2024 | 16.48 million |
| August 2024 | 21 million |
| September 2024 | 67.09 million |
| October 2024 | 80.16 million |
| November 2024 | 157.04 million |
| December 2024 | 154.68 million |

**Source:** [Semrush](https://www.semrush.com/website/bsky.app/overview/?utm_campaign=bluesky-statistics&utm_source=backlinko.com&utm_medium=referral)

## Bluesky Website Traffic by Country

In December 2024, the United States accounted for over half (**55.7%**) of website traffic to Bluesky website, followed by the UK (6.97%), Japan (6.75%), Canada (3.05%) and Brazil (3.01%).

**Source:** [Semrush](https://www.semrush.com/website/bsky.app/overview/?utm_campaign=bluesky-statistics&utm_source=backlinko.com&utm_medium=referral)

## Bluesky Users by Country

According to Bluesky CEO (Jay Graber), the countries with the highest number of Bluesky users are the United States, Japan, and Brazil.

**Source:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eeh2hf2r)

## Bluesky Funding

Bluesky raised **$23 million** across 2 rounds to date, including its latest $15 million Series A funding round announced in October 2024.

Here’s a breakdown of all funding rounds of Bluesky:

| Date | Funding Amount, Round |
|---|---|
| July 2023 | $8 million, Seed |
| October 2024 | $15 million, Series A |

**Source:** [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/10/24/bluesky-raises-15m-series-a-plans-to-launch-subscriptions/)

## How Many Employees Work at Bluesky?

Bluesky has **20 full-time employees and 100 contractors** who work as content moderators. Bluesky operates with a fully remote team.

At the time of writing, Bluesky had 2 publicly available job postings on its website.

**Source:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r), [Platformer](https://www.platformer.news/bluesky-growth-content-moderation-trust-safety-interview/)

## Conclusion

That’s it for my list of Bluesky user stats.

Bluesky is currently one of the fastest-growing social networks but as a private company they don’t disclose many details. So I did my best to find recent data from multiple sources to bring you the latest stats on one page."}

{"url": "https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/", "content": "---
title: Latest Bluesky User Count & Growth Stats (2025)
author: Zeid Abughazaleh
url: https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/
hostname: proxidize.com
description: The Bluesky user count has soared to over 25 million users as of December 2024, reflecting a remarkable surge from 13 million just two months earlier. The
sitename: Proxidize
date: 2025-01-30
---
The Bluesky user count has soared to over 25 million users as of December 2024, reflecting a remarkable surge from 13 million just two months earlier. The platform is currently growing at a rate of 5.4 users per second and is attracting approximately 466,500 new users daily.

This influx underscores Bluesky’s rapid expansion, especially among younger audiences where 42% of the user base is between 18-24. Brazil alone accounts for 37.7% of traffic, with the United States following at 25.6%.

In this article, we’ll examine Bluesky’s explosive growth, explore its user demographics, and discuss the key statistics that illustrate its emergence as a formidable social media platform.

**What Is Bluesky?**

Bluesky takes a novel approach to social networking by functioning as a decentralized platform built on the AT Protocol. The project is open-source, giving anyone transparent insight into its design. Users can share 300-character text messages, images, and videos, all while controlling the nature of their feeds.

But how exactly does Bluesky differentiate itself? One answer is its “marketplace of algorithms” that lets users choose or create custom feeds based on preferences. With over 50k custom feeds available, Bluesky offers a unique degree of flexibility in shaping one’s experience. The platform also includes user-managed moderation and labeling services, plus user-made “starter packs” that help newcomers jump in with relevant communities.

In terms of corporate identity, Bluesky operates as a Public Benefit Corporation, with ownership primarily held by CEO Jay Graber and the Bluesky team. They are supported by a board that features notable innovators like Jeremie Miller (inventor of Jabber/XMPP), Mike Masnick, and Kinjal Shah. This structure preserves the platform’s focus on growing and promoting open-source technology for decentralized public conversation.

Bluesky’s handle system is another hallmark. Instead of relying on standard “checkmarks,” the platform uses domain name-based handles that require users to prove domain ownership. This approach aims to preserve authenticity and give creators independence in self-identification.

**Who Owns Bluesky?**

Originally a Twitter-side project in 2019, Bluesky spun off in 2021 as an independent company and Public Benefit Corporation. Today, CEO Jay Graber — previously behind the event-coordination platform “Happening” — owns much of Bluesky, while the rest is distributed among the internal team.

The board includes:

**Jeremie Miller**: Renowned for inventing Jabber/XMPP.**Mike Masnick**: Founder of TechDirt and the Copia Institute think tank.**Kinjal Shah**: General partner at Blockchain Capital.

Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, who started the Bluesky initiative, left the board in May 2024. Post-departure, Dorsey directed a significant $5 million investment to Nostr, another decentralized platform. Meanwhile, Bluesky secured $5 million in funding — led by Blockchain Capital — in October 2024. So far, the company has raised $36 million in total, opting against traditional advertising and exploring subscription models instead.

**Explosive User Growth in 2024-2025**

September 2024 was pivotal for Bluesky: the platform went from 9 million users to 20 million by November, marking a jaw-dropping 189% growth rate that month — plus a 284% spike in daily active users.

Although growth slowed a bit in December, there was still a solid 9.6% increase in US website visits, easily outpacing competitor Threads, which slipped by 1.6%. Globally, Bluesky’s momentum in December 2024 looked like this:

**Monthly Growth**

Platform | Oct 2024 | Nov 2024 | Dec 2024 |
| Bluesky | 11.23% | 75.15% | 9.5% |
| Threads | 9.05% | 8.13% | 5.7% |
| X | 6.93% | -2.27% | 2.4% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Notably, the presidential election news in November 2024 acted as a huge catalyst, leading Bluesky to dominate the US App Store rankings for more than a week. High-profile users — including celebrities, journalists, and creators — flocked to the platform, driving up engagement by as much as tenfold for some organizations.

By the end of 2024, Bluesky’s worldwide growth had shot up by 930% year-over-year, while its two-year growth topped 30,564%. That performance solidified Bluesky’s status as a serious contender in the [social media](https://proxidize.com/blog/social-media-management/) network space.

**Key Growth Catalysts and Milestones**

**US Presidential Election Impact**

The US presidential election in November 2024 set off a surge of 13 million new users in just six weeks. During the window of November 6-15, daily website visits in the US ballooned by 519%, compared to average traffic for the first ten months of 2024.

Interactions also skyrocketed, with some organizations reporting a 2x to 10x jump in engagement. Unsurprisingly, the platform processed a record-breaking 6.5 million content violation reports — a 17-fold leap from the previous year.

**Brazil Market Expansion**

A temporary ban of X in Brazil led to Bluesky registering 2.6 million new users in a single week. Of those, a staggering 85% were from Brazil, fundamentally [reshaping the platform’s user demographics](https://proxidize.com/blog/geolocation-testing/):

Region | Traffic Share |
| Brazil | 37.7% |
| United States | 25.6% |
| Other Markets | 36.7% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

This sudden growth led to a backlog in user-managed moderation and labelling services, prompting Bluesky to scale its Portuguese-language moderation team and automate riskier areas. Simultaneously, an engineering team of 20 full-time employees (sometimes noted as 20 full-time employees) introduced new tools such as video sharing and trending topics to accommodate the larger audience.

**Bluesky Statistics**

Recent [demographic data](https://proxidize.com/use-cases/market-research/) offers a deep dive into Bluesky’s usage statistics. Notably, male users make up about 69.63% of the audience, while female users account for roughly 30.37%.

**Age and Gender Distribution**

The average user on Bluesky skews young, with 42% in the 18-24 bracket:

Age Group | Percentage |
| 18-24 | 42.0% |
| 25-34 | 27.5% |
| 35-44 | 13.3% |
| 45-54 | 7.7% |
| 55-64 | 5.6% |
| 65+ | 3.8% |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Altogether, 70% of active users are under 34, reflecting a strong foothold among younger demographics. Engagement metrics are equally robust: the average visit durations are 9 minutes 46 seconds, with 1.51 pages viewed per session.

In terms of traffic sources, direct access accounts for 44.1% of visits, referrals generate 29.06%, organic search pulls 21.26%, and social media funnels 4.79%.

Meanwhile, the platform’s lean workforce — about 20 full-time employees and 100 contractors — has managed to support the rising exodus of users from rival platforms while keeping moderation operations stable.

**Website Traffic Analysis**

In December 2024, Bluesky recorded 154.68 million monthly website visits — up 93% from October. The table below illustrates the platform’s top traffic sources:

**Direct**: 44.1%**Referral**: 29.06%**Organic Search**: 21.26%**Social Media**: 4.79%

**App Download Statistics**

Monthly app downloads remained consistently high in 2024:

Month (2024) | Downloads |
| September | 2.85M |
| October | 2.76M |
| November | 7.85M |
| December | 1.76M |

[Proxidize](https://proxidize.com/blog/bluesky-user-count-2025/)

Clearly, November was a surge in usage, coinciding with a broader exodus of users from competing services.

**User Engagement Rates**

Usage statistics also underscore Bluesky’s impressive engagement. On average, visitors spend around 9 minutes and 46 seconds per session. Overall figures include:

**Total posts**: 973.80 million**Total follows**: 1.982 billion**Total likes**: 4.698 billion

Publishers see some of the biggest gains, often experiencing 3-4x more clicks and conversions than on rival platforms. For instance, The Boston Globe logged a 4.5x increase in conversions to paid subscriptions via Bluesky compared to other social media service sites.

**Conclusion**

From 9 million to 25 million users in just a few months, Bluesky’s meteoric rise speaks for itself. The platform’s decentralization, block feature, and algorithmic choice have proven especially appealing to users looking for a social platform that puts them in control.

**Key Takeaways:**

**Young, Global Demographic**: 42% of users are 18-24, with Brazil at 37.7% of traffic and the US at 25.6%.**Decentralized Platform**: Built on the AT Protocol, offering over 50k custom feeds and user-managed moderation.**Explosive Growth**: Jumped from 9M to 20M users in two months, peaking with a 189% monthly growth rate and 930% year-over-year increase.**Election & Brazil Ban Boost**: US presidential election added 13M users in six weeks; X’s ban in Brazil brought 2.6M users in one week.**High Engagement**: Average session lasts 9 minutes 46 seconds; total posts at 973.80M, total follows at 1.982B, total likes at 4.698B.**Bright Outlook**: Annual growth of 930% and two-year growth of 30,564% underscore Bluesky’s appeal as a fast-scaling social media platform.

The cross-border appeal — spanning from the US to Brazil — backs up its ambition to become more than just another social network. Average session lengths nearing 10 minutes and triple-digit traffic growth show that this social media app is managing to sustain engagement, even with a relatively small employee base.

Perhaps most notably, Bluesky’s annual growth of 930% and two-year growth hitting 30,564% confirm its ability to scale and keep pace with user demand. As daily users continue to climb, the platform’s future looks bright, thanks to its decentralized platform model, user-focused features, and an ever-expanding user base that craves genuine engagement.

**Sources:**

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Is Bluesky growing?**

As of December 2024, Bluesky has surpassed 25 million users and has grown by around 466,500 new users daily. In the US, it has even outpaced other platforms like Instagram Threads in December 2024.

**How many active users are on Bluesky?**

As of late 2024, Bluesky’s user count stands at 25 million. Following November’s presidential election, it gained 13 million users in six weeks.

**Which age group is most prevalent on Bluesky?**

The 18-24 age bracket, which makes up 42% of Bluesky’s **user base**. Altogether, 70% of users are under 34.

**How engaged are Bluesky users?**

Visitors spend an average of 9 minutes and 46 seconds per session, viewing about 1.51 pages each visit. The platform has nearly 973.80 million total posts and 1.982 billion total follows — indicating active app users.

**How does Bluesky’s growth compare to other social media platforms?**

In 2024, Bluesky’s worldwide growth skyrocketed by 930% from the previous year, with two-year gains hitting an astonishing 30,564%. During December 2024, Bluesky’s 9.5% monthly growth also surpassed Threads (5.7%) and X (2.4%)."}

title: Bluesky Statistics For 2025 (Users, Demographics, Growth)
author: Adam Connell
url: https://adamconnell.me/bluesky-statistics/
hostname: adamconnell.me
description: Bluesky is one of the fastest-growing social apps. In this post, Ill share 27 Bluesky statistics you need to know, covering users, demographics, and more.
sitename: Adam Connell
date: 2025-01-16
---
# Bluesky Statistics For 2025 (Users, Demographics, Growth)

Looking for the latest Bluesky statistics? Youre in the right place.

Bluesky is the app everyones talking about right now.

Following a recent surge in user numbers, its become one of the fastest-growing social media platforms. This has led many to wonder if Bluesky will finally emerge as a serious competitor to rival platform X (formerly Twitter).

In this post, Ill be sharing 27 stats that reveal more about Blueskys meteoric growth, its user demographics, and other interesting insights.

## Top picks

- Bluesky has 23.2 million total users and 3.2 million daily active users (Theo.io, Similarweb3)
- Users visit the Bluesky website 75.8 million times monthly (Similarweb)
- and download the Bluesky app 400k times daily (Appfigures)
- Bluesky users have shared over 658 million posts in total (bsky.jazco.dev)
- Bluesky users have followed accounts 1.1 billion times and liked posts 1.1 billion times (bsky.jazco.dev)
- Bluesky (@bsky.app) is the most-followed account on the platform (VQV.APP)
- Most Bluesky users are from Brazil (37.7%), the US (25.6%), and Japan (8.7%) (Similarweb, Bluesky1)

## Bluesky user statistics

First, lets look at statistics that highlight how many people currently use Bluesky, how those numbers have changed over time, and the factors that are driving its growth.

### 1. Bluesky has over 23.2 million total registered users

At the time of writing, around 23.2 million people have signed up for Blueskyand that figure is changing rapidly. By the time you read this post, it may be significantly higher.

Bluesky still has a long way to go to catch up to rival platform X, which is the 11th [most-used social media platform](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/) with 619 million users. However, if Bluesky maintains its current momentum, it may begin to close that gap over the next few years.

Source: Theo.io

### 2. thats up from just 1 million users last year

Since raising their seed round in 2023, Bluesky has gone from an invite-only app with a modest 1 million users to an open app with more than 23.2 million users from all over the worldand counting!

Whats more, most of those new users signed up in just the last few months alone. Bluesky had just 5 million users as of March 2024. And an incredible 2.6 million new users registered within just a few days at the start of September 2024.

Source: Bluesky6

### 3. and is increasing by 5.4 users per second

According to theo.ios user counter, 5.4 users are registering for Bluesky every second (at the time of writing). That works out to 324 new users a minute, 19,440 new users an hour, and roughly 466.5k new users a day.

The rate at which new users sign up for the platform is constantly changingand its been even faster in the past. At one point in November this year, Bluesky was adding roughly a million new users a day.

Source: Theo.io, Bluesky5

### 4. Bluesky has around 3.2 million daily active users (DAUs) in the US

As of mid-November 2024, around 3.2 million people in the US use Bluesky daily. That number has ticked up dramatically over the last month.

Site: Similarweb3

### 5. Bluesky usage in the US is up 500% since election day

The US election served as a catalyst for the ongoing exodus of users from Blueskys rival social media app, X.

Many liberal users expressed concerns about misinformation on the platform, as well as concerns that X was used as a vehicle to help with the Republicans election campaign due to owner Elon Musks political leanings and close ties to the Trump administration.

As a result, liberal users have been leaving X in drovesand many of them have found their way to Bluesky, which has caused this recent surge in usage. Aside from the US, Bluesky usage is also up 350% in the UK since the US election.

Site: Similarweb3

### 6. Bluesky gained 3 million new users the week after X was suspended in Brazil

Earlier this year, Brazils Supreme Court suspended X. As a result, Brazilians who could no longer access X signed up for Bluesky instead, which led to one of the biggest leaps in user numbers Bluesky has seen to date.

Source: Bluesky7

### 7. and 1.2 million new users in the days following the announcement that X would change the block feature

Earlier this year, X made the controversial decision to change its block feature so that users could still see content from accounts theyd blockeda change that was widely criticized.

Again, Bluesky was well-positioned to capitalize on this as 1.2 million disgruntled users who left X as a result of the change signed up for Bluesky instead.

Source: Bluesky8

### 8. There are over 671 million posts on Bluesky

and counting! Users create tens of thousands of posts every day, so by the time youre reading this, there are probably already millions more.

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 9. There are around 1.3 million daily unique posters on Bluesky

This varies every day, but its somewhere around that ballpark at the time of writing (November 2024).

Notably, thats significantly higher than last month, when there were just 293k unique daily posters.

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

## Bluesky engagement statistics

Next, lets look at some more Bluesky statistics about how users engage with content and accounts on the platform.

### 10. There are over 1.1 billion total followers across all Bluesky accounts

Thats the number you get if you add up the followers of every user on Bluesky.

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 11. and over 2.9 billion total likes

Users on Bluesky have liked a combined total of 2.9 billion posts so far and counting!

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 12. 50% of Bluesky users only have 1 follower

As Bluesky is still in its infancy, few users on the platform have managed to gain a significant number of followers (yet). Around half of all Bluesky users only have a single follower, and only the top 0.01% have accrued over 10k followers.

Percentage of accounts | Number of followers |
| 50% | 1+ |
| 25% | 6+ |
| 10% | 34+ |
| 5% | 85+ |
| 1% | 400+ |
| 0.1% | 2,238+ |
| 0.01% | 11,241+ |

*Related: **How To Grow Your Social Media Following The Right Way*

Source: bsky.jazco.dev

### 13. The most followed account on Bluesky is Bluesky!

When you sign up for Bluesky, you automatically follow Bluesky (@bsky.app) by default. So unsurprisingly, Bluesky is the most-followed account on the platform with 15.9 million followers.

The table below shows the rest of the top-5 most-followed accounts on the platform at the time of writing.

Top 5 most-followed Bluesky accounts | Number of followers |
| Bluesky (@bsky.app) | 15.9 million |
| Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (@aoc.bsky.social) | 914,000 |
| George Takei (@georgetakei.bsky.social) | 797,000 |
| The New York Times (@nytimes.com) | 725,000 |
| The Onion (@theonion.com) | 704,000 |

Source: VQV.APP

### 14. The most-liked post on Bluesky has 242.3k likes

According to Blueskys feed of most popular posts on platforms by likes, the most-liked post is from Bluesky themselves (@bsky.app), in which they celebrate reaching a million new users.

The second most-liked post is another celebratory post from Bluesky (222.3k likes), and the third is from Mark Hamill (@markhamillofficial.bsky.social) with a joke about quitting Twitter (170.1k likes).

Source: Bluesky2

### 15. There are over 50,000 custom feeds on Bluesky

One of the things that differentiates Bluesky from competitors like X is that it offers algorithmic choice by letting users create their own custom feeds to determine what content they see.

Alternatively, they can deploy custom feeds that other users have created from the open marketplace. Over 50k custom feeds have been built so far.

## Bluesky traffic & app downloads

Below youll find traffic statistics from Similarweb that reveal insights about Blueskys website visitors.

### 16. People visited the Bluesky website over 75.8 million times last month

According to Similarwebs traffic data, the Bluesky website (bsky.app) had around 75.8 million total website visits. Note that this doesnt mean Bluesky had over 75.8 million *unique *visitorsmany of those visits will be repeat visits from the same users.

Source: Similarweb

### 17. The average visit duration for Bluesky is 9 minutes, 46 seconds

This should be a fairly good indication of the typical Bluesky session duration, i.e. how long the average user stays on Bluesky when they open the app/website.

Source: Similarweb

### 18. Bluesky is downloaded around 400k times a day

At the time of writing, Bluesky is downloaded around 400k times per day, on average. It overtook X (which has 250k daily downloads, on average) for the first time this month (November 2024).

Source: Appfigures

### 19. Bluesky was downloaded 3.2 million times last month

Users downloaded Bluesky around 3.2 million times in October 2024. That figure was even higher in September at 5.1 million.

Source: Similarweb2

### 20. Bluesky was downloaded over 9 million times in the second half of 2024

And were not even at the end of the year yet, so expect that figure to increase. In comparison, Bluesky was downloaded only 1.4 million times in the first half of 2024.

Source: Business of Apps

### 21. Bluesky recently became the #1 top-performing app in the App Store

In November 2024, Bluesky became the #1 app in Apples App Store charts, with rival Threads in the #2 spot. The App Store charts rank apps based on download and revenue velocity, which suggests Bluesky is one of the fastest-growing apps this month.

Source: Forbes, Apple

## Bluesky demographics

What demographics make up Blueskys user base? Lets look at some more Bluesky statistics to find out.

### 22. 64% of Bluesky users are male

Almost two-thirds of those who visit Bluesky are male (64%), while only a little over one-third are female (36%). This is based on traffic data from Similarweb as Bluesky hasnt publicly shared its own internal data about user demographics.

Source: Similarweb

### 23. 42% of Bluesky users are 18 to 24 years old

It seems that Bluesky primarily appeals to younger users. According to Similarwebs traffic data, around 42% of visitors to the site are between the ages of 18 to 24.

Age | % of Bluesky website traffic |
| 18-24 | 42% |
| 25-34 | 27.5% |
| 35-44 | 13.3% |
| 45-54 | 7.7% |
| 55-64 | 5.6% |
| 65+ | 3.8% |

Source: Similarweb

### 24. 37.7% of Blueskys traffic comes from Brazil

According to Similarweb, Brazil accounts for a greater portion of Blueskys website traffic than any other country. Its followed by the US (25.6%), Japan (8.7%), and the UK (3.8%).

Blueskys Jay (@jay.bsky.team) also confirmed in a recent post that the US, Japan, and Brazil are the three biggest countries using the app.

Source: Similarweb, Bluesky1

## Misc. Bluesky statistics

Before we wrap up, here are a few more stats about Bluesky that you might find interesting.

### 25. Bluesky currently only has around 20 full-time employees

That works out at around a million users per employee, but Bluesky has said that theyre hiring, so expect this number to shoot up soon.

Source: Bluesky3

### 26. Bluesky has raised $23 million in funding

That includes a more recent $15 million series A funding round and an $8 million seed round in 2023.

Source: TechCrunch

### 27. The first ever post on Bluesky was from Paul Frazee (@pfrazee.com)

The inaugural post on Bluesky was made by developer Paul Frazee on November 16, 2022. Staying true to internet tradition, it was a simple yet iconic declaration: First!

Source: Bluesky4

## Final thoughts

As these stats show, Bluesky is currently one of the fastest-growing social media apps.

Its successfully capitalized on the controversy surrounding X and is siphoning its users at an alarming rate.

Whether or not it will maintain its current growth rate remains to be seen. But if it does, it could spell disaster for competitors X and Threads.

Very few [social media schedulers](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-scheduler-tools/) support the platform which is likely an issue for some. That said, you can schedule to Bluesky with [SocialBee](https://adamconnell.me/go/socialbee/) (aff).

Hungry for more stats? Check out these interesting [social media statistics](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-statistics/) and [influencer marketing statistics](https://adamconnell.me/influencer-marketing-statistics/). You might also be interested in our comprehensive ranking of [the leading social media platforms by monthly active users](https://adamconnell.me/social-media-platforms/).

**Related reading:**", "question_id": "0309272e-d2c0-5627-ae4e-f552e33c51b8", "question": "Will the total number of posts made on Bluesky on March 30, 2025 be less than 4 million?", "background": "'Twitter Quitters' Help Boost Bluesky to More Than 27 Million Users", "resolution_criteria": "This question resolves based on the number of posts made on Bluesky according to Jaz's Bluesky index for March 30, 2025. The question resolves as YES if the total number of posts is less than 4 million, and NO otherwise.", "present_date": "2025-03-23T01:08:34.130525", "date_cutoff_start": "2025-03-01", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-23"}

title: Bluesky User Age, Gender, & Demographics (2025)
author: Fabio Duarte
url: https://explodingtopics.com/blog/bluesky-users
hostname: explodingtopics.com
description: Up-to-date data on X competitor Bluesky including user age, gender, and regional statistics.
sitename: Exploding Topics
date: 2025-01-06
---
# Bluesky User Age, Gender, & Demographics (2025)

First launched as an independent company in 2021, Bluesky has gained plenty of recent adopters, [seeing rapid growth](https://www.similarweb.com/blog/insights/social-media-news/bluesky-sustained-growth/) in late 2024.

Many former [X users](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/x-user-stats) are [making the switch](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c8dm0ljg4y6o) from Elon Musks platform following increased politicization during the US elections.

Below, well dive into key data related to Blueskys user base:

**Contents**

[Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-top-stats)[Bluesky User Statistics](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-stats)[Bluesky Users By Age](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-age)[Bluesky Users By Gender](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-gender)[Bluesky Users By Region](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-region)[Bluesky Users By Platform](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-platform)[Bluesky User Habits](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-habits)[Most Popular Accounts On Bluesky](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-popular-accounts)

### Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)

- There are
**over 33 million**Bluesky users **Approximately 1**user joins Bluesky every second- The Bluesky website gets
[196 million](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain)[visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain) **Around one-third**of Bluesky users are 18 to 24 years old**Over 60%**of Bluesky users are male**Around 2 in 5**Bluesky users are American**Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez**is the most-followed person on Bluesky

### Bluesky User Statistics

In March 2025, the total user count crossed the 33 million mark.

*Pale blue bars are estimated.*

This figure has **almost doubled** in a matter of weeks, growing from **13 million** in late October 2024, and **25 million **in December 2024.

Heres how the number of Bluesky users has increased in Q4 2024:

| Date | Number of Bluesky Users |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 13, 2024 | 25 million |
| December 18, 2024 | 25.4 million |
| March 11, 2025 | 33 million |

At the current adoption rate, Blueskys user base is growing by **approximately 1** user per second.

If that rate were to hold firm, Bluesky would hit** 53 million** users by December 2025. And by December 2026, Bluesky will have surpassed **84 million** users.

The Bluesky website gets [ 196 million visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain), of which

**41.3 million**are unique visitors.

Much of Blueskys increased popularity has coincided with a downturn in competitor X's daily active users.


X has largely seen daily user numbers decrease as many flock to alternative Bluesky.

That's part of a wider trend of users seeking out "alternative" social platforms. Pixelfed is gaining in popularity as a decentralized Instagram equivalent, while [RedNote](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/rednote-surge) has seen a surge in US users amid the threat of a TikTok ban.

### Want to Spy on Your Competition?

Explore competitors website traffic stats, discover growth points, and expand your market share.

**Sources:** [Jaz](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), [TechCrunch](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1536616/global-bluesky-users/), [Theo.io](https://bsky-users.theo.io/), [The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/media/2024/dec/11/from-x-to-bluesky-why-are-people-abandoning-twitter-digital-town-square), [VQV](https://vqv.app/stats/)

### Bluesky Users by Age

According to November 2024 data, **around 1 in 3** Bluesky users are aged 18 to 24.

And the majority **(62.64%)** are under 34 years old.

Heres a breakdown of Bluesky users by age:

| Age Bracket | Distribution |
| 18 to 24 years | 35.02% |
| 25 to 34 years | 27.67% |
| 35 to 44 years | 14.67% |
| 45 to 54 years | 10.03% |
| 55 to 64 years | 7.74% |
| 65+ years | 4.92% |

**Source:** [SimilarWeb](https://www.similarweb.com/website/bsky.app/#traffic)

### Bluesky Users by Gender

More than half of Bluesky users are male **(62.04%)**.

That figure ranks Bluesky as one of the most male-dominated social media platforms behind Discord **(66.6%) **and Reddit **(63.6%)**.

Heres a closer look at the distribution of gender on social media:

| Social Media Platform | Male Visitors | Female Visitors |
| Discord | 66.6% | 32.2% |
| 63.6% | 35.1% | |
Bluesky | 62.04 | 37.96% |
| X | 60.9% | 39.1% |
| Telegram | 57.5% | 42.4% |
| 56.8% | 43.2% | |
| Quora | 56.6% | 43% |
| 56.4% | 43.6% | |
| Messenger | 55.5% | 44.5% |
| YouTube | 54.4% | 45.6% |
| Kuaishou | 53% | 47% |
| 52.3% | 47.6% | |
| TikTok | 52% | 48% |
| 52% | 48% | |
| 51.2% | 48.8% | |
| 50.6% | 49.4% | |
| Snapchat | 49.2% | 49% |
| 49% | 51% | |
| 22.4% | 69.5% |

**Sources: **[SimilarWeb](https://www.similarweb.com/website/bsky.app/#traffic), [Data Reportal](https://www.statista.com/statistics/274828/gender-distribution-of-active-social-media-users-worldwide-by-platform/)

### Bluesky Users by Region

According to [Semrush traffic data for Bluesky.com](https://www.semrush.com/website/bluesky.com/overview/), the site had 362,000 visitors in November 2024.

The US has the largest proportion of Bluesky visitors, at **42.27%**.

In fact, Bluesky sees more visitors from the US than the rest of the top five nations combined **(27.91%)**.

Here are the top five countries by Bluesky visitors:

| Rank | Country | Proportion of Bluesky Users | Visit Duration | Pages/Visits | Bounce Rate |
| 1 | US | 42.27% | 12 mins 9 secs | 8.41 | 33.97% |
| 2 | Brazil | 11.01% | 11 mins 21 secs | 9.93 | 28.74% |
| 3 | UK | 7.51% | 13 mins 32 secs | 8.41 | 27.01% |
| 4 | Japan | 6.18% | 6 mins 26 secs | 5.16 | 52.53% |
| 5 | Germany | 3.21% | 10 mins 14 secs | 7.01 | 40.93% |
| - | Others | 29.82% | - | - | - |

**Source: **[SimilarWeb](https://pro.similarweb.com/#/digitalsuite/websiteanalysis/audience-geography/*/999/1m?key=bsky.app&webSource=Total)

### Bluesky Users by Platform

February 2024 saw by far the most Bluesky downloads for both iOS **(670,722)** and Android **(567,267) **operating systems.

Between February 2023 and March 2024, iOS monthly downloads have outnumbered Android on **12 of 14 **occasions.

However, each of the four most recent recorded months (May to July 2024) saw Android downloads surpass iOS. In fact, during this period, Android amassed almost twice as many downloads as iOS **(473,703 vs 240,132)**.

Heres a breakdown of Bluesky downloads by platform over time:

| Month, Year | iOS Downloads | Android Downloads |
| Feb, 2023 | 15,417 | - |
| Mar, 2023 | 87,516 | - |
| Apr 2023 | 431,999 | 152,375 |
| May 2023 | 176,288 | 78,688 |
| Jun 2023 | 56,846 | 32,292 |
| Jul 2023 | 326,608 | 288,936 |
| Aug 2023 | 189,795 | 126,068 |
| Sep 2023 | 238,318 | 235,117 |
| Oct 2023 | 299,109 | 349,052 |
| Nov 2023 | 192,199 | 224,450 |
| Dec 2023 | 274,685 | 235,960 |
| Jan 2024 | 97,826 | 84,220 |
| Feb 2024 | 670,722 | 567,267 |
| Mar 2024 | 85,949 | 68,147 |
| Apr 2024 | 84,289 | 190,522 |
| May 2024 | 37,866 | 41,076 |
| Jun 2024 | 87,899 | 204,271 |
| Jul 2024 | 30,078 | 37,834 |

**Source: **[Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1382164/bluesky-worldwide-downloads-by-platform/)

### Bluesky User Habits

**Around** **1.18 million** posts have been made on Bluesky as of March 2025. That equates to **35 **posts per user.

Based on November 2024 data, the average Bluesky visit lasts **10 minutes and 35 seconds**. Thats just under the X average of **12 minutes and 1 second **per visit.

Heres a comparison between average visit durations for selected social media platforms:

| Platform | Average Visit Duration |
| YouTube | 20 minutes, 19 seconds |
| X | 12 minutes, 1 second |
| 10 minutes, 57 seconds | |
Bluesky | 10 minutes, 35 seconds |
| Snapchat | 8 minutes, 45 seconds |
| 8 minutes, 37 seconds | |
| 6 minutes, 3 seconds | |
| TikTok | 3 minutes, 54 seconds |

On average, each Bluesky user visits **approximately** **8** pages per session.

By comparison, X users visit around 50% more pages (**approximately 12** per session).

Below, is a breakdown of the average users number of social media pages per visit:

| Platform | Average Pages/Visit |
| X | 12.26 |

# Bluesky Statistics: How Many People Use Bluesky?

Written by [Backlinko Team](https://backlinko.com/blog/authors/backlinko-team)

Publicly launched in February 2024, Bluesky is a microblogging social network, widely considered an alternative to X/Twitter.

During the invite-only stage, Bluesky attracted an audience of 3 million registered users and has since grown to become a popular social media platform with over 27 million users and counting.

Read on to find all the latest Bluesky usage statistics for 2025.

## Key Bluesky Stats

- Bluesky has
**27.44 million**users. - In November 2024, monthly installs of Bluesky app reached
**7.85 million**. - In the US and UK, Bluesky app has around
**3.5 million**daily active users. **20**full-time employees work at Bluesky
